messages.body:
9 October 2012

Hello My Dearest,
My name is Miss. Fatima Kones , 23 years old originated from Nairobi-Kenya, East Africa, Female, tall, slim, fair and a very good  looking girl that loves traveling and dancing, a student, that loves  to be loved, I want you to also understand that your Age,  distance,Religions does not matter to me, kindly permit me to contact  you through this medium, I am compelled to contact you via this medium  for obvious reasons which you will understand when we discuss details of my proposition.
My father was the former Assistant Minister of Home Affairs and the Kenya road Minister Mr. Kipkalya Kones had been on board the Cessna 210,which was headed to Kericho and crashed in a remote area called Kajong'a, in western Kenya .


After the burial of my father, my step-mother has threatened to kill me because of the money my father deposited in one of the banks in Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso in my name as the next of kin before his dead which amount is ($10.7USD) Million United State Dollars. I travelled down to Burkina Faso to withdraw the money so that I can start a better life and take care of myself.



On my arrival, the Branch manager of the Bank whom I met in person told me that my father's instruction to the bank was the money will be release to me only when I am married or I should present a trustee who will help me and invest the money overseas. I have chosen to contact you after my prayers and I believe that you will not betray the trust I have on you. But rather take me as your own daughter or your Sister.Though you may wonder why I am so soon revealing myself to you without knowing you, well, I will say that my mind convinced me that you are the true person to help me stand as my trustee since I have not married.
Moreso, I will like to disclose much to you if you can help me to relocate in your country because my Step-Mother has threatened to assassinate me. Also be informed that I have confirmed from the bank in BurkinaFaso that the money is still unclaimed. You will also help me to a place were the money will be establish a more profitable business venture in your Country. Moreover, you will also help me by recommending a nice University in your country so that I will complete my studies.


Itis my intention to compensate you with 30% of the total money for your services and the balance shall be my capital in your establishment. As soon as I receive your interest in helping me, I will put things into action immediately. In the light of the above, I shall appreciate an urgent message indicating your ability and willingness to handle this transaction sincerely. Please do keep this only to your self. I beg you not to disclose it to anybody until the money transferred into your bank account and then I will come over to your country.
I am waiting to hear from you soonest,
Yours Sincerely,
Miss. Fatima k.Kones.
messages.raw:
Fatima Kones

 

 

 

 

Paragraphs, apparently unknown in "Fatima's" country, have been inserted for readability.

So, here's Fatima... with a script that starts like a romance scam and mutates into a standard rich orphan modality. I've heard that the opening lines are classical Senegalese Laddish.

"Fatima" is not Fatima, is not related to the late Mr. Kones, there is no money waiting for you in Ouagadougou, and if that wasn't clear from the start, please return to the home page and review everything S L O W L Y.

On my arrival, the Branch manager of the Bank whom I met in person told me that my father's instruction to the bank was the money will be release to me only when I am married or I should present a trustee who will help me and invest the money overseas. You will also help me to a place were the money will be establish a more profitable business venture in your Country. Moreover, you will also help me by recommending a nice University in your country so that I will complete my studies.

Itis my intention to compensate you with 30% of the total money for your services and the balance shall be my capital in your establishment. I beg you not to disclose it to anybody until the money transferred into your bank account and then I will come over to your country. I am waiting to hear from you soonest,
Yours Sincerely,
Miss. Fatima k.Kones.

9 January 2013

Attn:
This is Dr. Temitope Oshikoya, the director general of The West Africa Monetary Institute. 
Numbers of diplomats who are in the custody of the police here in Accra Ghana was brought to my office by the I.G.P Inspector General of Police.
These diplomats where caught by the police men trying to make a change of name of the consignment boxes that is on their possession. 
I as i speak with you now, the boxes are with the police and they will be making the release of the boxes to our office in order to carryout the delivery with a special diplomat or by online transfer as soon as the rightful beneficiary (you) registered the boxes with them (police) why these selfish and greedy diplomats will face the law.
I am telling you proudly that as soon as the police make the release of the boxes to us after the registration, a special diplomat to the police of Ghana and United Nation (UN) will embark on the delivery or online transfer by bank to bank to avoid any kind of delay and problems, because numbers of foreign beneficiary has being complaining of their boxes not been delivered to them by diplomats after all the payment they've made, i strongly believe it's also the same too with you.  We will be using a special diplomat to the police and UN because of the above reasons.
Sir. all we need from you now is for you to get back to us with the bellow details and get your boxes registered in order for your boxes to be release by the police for delivery or online transfer.
A COPY OF YOUR INTERNATIONAL PASSPORT/ DRIVERS LICENSE............
NATIONALITY..............................................................
DATE OF BATH........................................................
NEAREST AIRPORT TO YOUR RESIDENTIAL ADDRESS............................................
DISTANCE DRIVE FROM AIRPORT TO YOUR HOME......
TELEPHONE NUMBER................................................
                                            OR
VALID BANK DETAILS.

 All these details will enable us to get your boxes registered and make a smooth and fast delivery of your boxes to you, and please note that is a special diplomat to the police and UN that will be meeting with you to make your delivery of four boxes to you in order to put and end to your long  time pending fund here in Ghana cause this is a new year.
Please take note of the follows, 1) Registration of boxes with the police. 2) Getting the boxes stamp at Kotoka International Airport Ghana. 3) You picking up the diplomat up from your airport after arrival at your provided airport. If you know that you can meet up and agreed with this three things above, then we need you to get back to us, but if not please highly disregard this letter.
I will be waiting to read to from you soon. Thank you.
Attach to this message is my ID and IP.
Regards
Dr. Temitope Oshikoya
Director General
West Africa Monetary Institute

messages.body:
Dr Oshikoya
Actually diplomats cannot be arrested or placed on trial. It's in the Vienna Convention; "Diplomatic immunity is a form of legal immunity and a policy held between governments to ensure that diplomats are given safe passage and are considered not susceptible to lawsuit or prosecution under the host country's laws, although they can still be expelled."
So that means that you and your RULE OF LAW are going to get you into serious trouble. 
You' should hope for your sake that you do not cause the US or the Russians any trouble.
Roscoe White
